text: Give two examples of connective tissue.
Describe the structure and function of epithelial tissue with types.
answer:
Epithelial tissue covers body surfaces and lines cavities. Cells are tightly packed with minimal intercellular space.
Types:
1. Squamous – Thin, allows diffusion.
2. Cuboidal – Cube-shaped, secretion and absorption.
3. Columnar – Tall, absorption and secretion.
4. Ciliated – Moves particles or fluids.
5. Glandular – Secretion.

text: Explain the structure and functions of areolar connective tissue.
answer:
Structure: Loose arrangement of fibers and cells (fibroblasts, macrophages, mast cells) in a semi-fluid matrix.
Functions: Binds skin to underlying structures, acts as a packing tissue, provides flexibility, supports blood vessels and nerves.
